0.user_question: There are 5826942 unicorns left in the world.  One third of them are in the Scottish Highlands.  Two thirds of the Scottish unicorns are female.  How many female Scottish unicorns are there?

direct_answer.text: First calculate one third of the global population of unicorns which reside in Scotland i.e., (5826942 / 3) = 1942314 male & Female Unicorns together; since females constitute twice as many numbers than males we can split this equally into three parts hence yielding ((1942314/3)=647438). Hence Total Number Of Females=(((Total Male+Female)/2)*2)= 647438*2=1294876 Female Unicorns in Scotland Globally..
